description:

name: Frontend 2013 #2
description:
Co?

Pierwszy Frontend zakończył się sukcesem, więc nie czekając długo idziemy za ciosem i organizujemy kolejne spotkanie dla deweloperów zainteresowanych technologiami frontendowymi. Tym razem wiedzą podzielą się z nami Mariusz oraz Wojtek. Dodatkowo, w ramach krótkiego wstępu Dawid opowie o tym, na czym polega jego praca w Google i jak Google może pomóc społeczności deweloperskiej.

Agenda?

Przywitanie, czym jest GDG i jakie są najbliższe plany Jak Google wspiera deweloperów? - Dawid Ostrowski Emotional Design - Mariusz Cieśla Responsive websites. Toolbox - Wojtek Zając Obie prezentacje będą przedstawione w języku polskim.

name: GDG Business: Google Analytics #1
description:
Co?

Zapraszamy na pierwsze spotkanie skierowane zarówno do developerów, jak i osób zarządzających własnym serwisem internetowym. W najbliższy wtorek Michał opowie o narzędziu Google Analytics.

Przyjdź i dowiedz się jak na podstawie statystyk ruchu na stronie możesz rozwijać swój serwis!

 

Agenda

Na spotkaniu dowiesz się m.in:

czym jest Google Analytics, jak mierzyć oglądalność w serwisie www, jak mierzyć konwersje celu oraz transakcje typu e-commerce, jak można integrować dane z różnych źródeł w jednym narzędziu do analizy ruchu na stronie, jak poprawnie wdrożyć Google Analytics w swoim serwisie, jak interpretować podstawowe raporty.

 

Prowadzący

Spotkanie poprowadzi +Michał Bryś - specjalista analityki internetowej oraz marketingu w wyszukiwarkach.

Michał zajmuje się analizą ruchu w serwisach www i ich optymalizacją. Posiada certyfikaty Google Analytics Indivdual Qualified (GAIQ) oraz Google AdWords w zakresie raportowania i analizy (GAP).

 

Prezentacja będzie przedstawiona w języku polskim.

name: AppEngine with Python

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
W tym tygodniu spojrzymy na Google AppEngine oraz jak wykorzystywać udostępniane na nim API Pythonowe.

Prezentację poprowadzi Rafał Zając, o którym kilka słów poniżej:

Worked and lived in USA for 9 years. CTO and co-founder of www.radioflag.com - California based social platform startup for radio enthusiasts. Worked with companies like CarsDirect.com, InternetBrands.com, SendGrid.com... Currently working in Krakow as lead PHP and JavaScript programmer for online travel agency - airplane ticket search engines www.fru.pl, www.vola.ro, www.avio.ua, www.avia.vn  

Ogólny outline prezentacji wygląda się następująco:

Introduction to Google App Engine (Python) Why AppEngine? AppEngine services introduction with code examples Datastore Models (Entities) Types Mail XMPP Memcache Task Queues Cron URL Fetch Hello World Development Server AppEngine configuration AppEngine Console Quick mention of Backends Cloud SQL Full Text Search Images Service BlobStore Channel API Pipelines API Mapreduce API  

Do zobaczenia!

name: It's time to Go! - with Andrew Gerrand
description:
It's time to Go!


 

The meeting will be a 4 hour long workshop with one of the core contributors of the Go - Andrew Gerrand!

All we ask you to bring is:

your notebook, any text editor (go highlighting would be nice: intellij, vim, emacs, sublime, gedit) with Go installed! (instructions)(nice "getting started")

 

We also ask you to watch at least one of the presentations listed bellow. You can see this as an "admission fee" to the work shop - we want every participant (no matter if gopher or go-newbie to have at least a basic idea about what Go is before the workshop).

Video [2010] - Another Go at Language Design 1h / Andrew Video [2011] - Real World Go 45m / Andrew Video [2011] - Writing Web Apps in Go 50m / Andrew + Rob Video [2012] - Go Concurrency Patterns 50m / Rob Slides - Concurrency is not Parallelism 
 Online Tutorial: A Tour of Go  

Friends:

 

 

 

You may also want to check out Railsberry, where Andrew will be presenting that week!

name: "The president is..." - AppEngine workshops with Martin Gorner

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
Back on the backend! Continuing with AppEngine right where we left off, Googler Martin Gorner has come to Kraków and would like to do workshops with us :-)

Based on the title I seem to recognise this workshop from JFokus, which is a great conference so I'd expect nothing less from this workshop ;-)

 

Everyone is invited, but these are the things you MUST prepare beforehand:

JDK 7 (not JRE) Eclipse for Java EE Developers The objectify-4.xx.jar libraryDownload it, explanations later. Google Plugin for Eclipse
and
Google App Engine Java SDK
available in Eclipse: Help › Install New Software › Add ... http://dl.google.com/eclipse/plugin/4.2  

"The president is..." a codelab in the cloud with App Engine:

You won the contract of your life. You have to develop the web site announcing the results of the American presidential election. It must have the basic social features people expect as well as the capacity to sustain the traffic of the entire world visiting it at once when results are published. You have only 2 hours but also a powerful tool: the Google datacenter infrastructure.

 

Google's infrastructure supports 3 billion search queries every day, each of them returning results from 30,000 billion indexed pages. 72 hours of video are uploaded to YouTube every minute. 3/4 of a billion Android devices contribute to trafic on Gmail, Google maps or Google+ and these are just a few examples.

 

But did you know that you can use this infrastructure to power your next big idea ? Come to this codelab to learn how.

 

Martin Gorner:

Martin has worked on Mobipocket's ebook technologies which later became the software stack of the Kindle and which he helped develop for a couple more years as CEO of the Amazon-owned Mobipocket subsidiary. He is passionate about science, tehnology, computers, algorithms and everything in between including robots and HTML5. He joined Google Developer Relations in 2011.

name: Skin the Droid in WebGL - HTML5 Workshops

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
And another meetup / workshop with our guest Martin! This time focused on 3D graphics in the browser!

 

Skin the droid in WebGL
WebGL makes 3D in the browser possible without plugins, THREE.js makes it fun. In this codelab, you will experiment with the basics of 3D (camera, lighting, geometries, materials) and then with more advanced models and effects (normal mapping, bump mapping, environment map, ...). Only Javascript is needed. No prior 3D rendering knowledge required.

 

Martin Gorner:

Martin has worked on Mobipocket's ebook technologies which later became the software stack of the Kindle and which he helped develop for a couple more years as CEO of the Amazon-owned Mobipocket subsidiary. He is passionate about science, tehnology, computers, algorithms and everything in between including robots and HTML5. He joined Google Developer Relations in 2011.

name: Warsztaty AngularJS

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
Zapraszamy na intensywne, darmowe, ośmiogodzinne warsztaty na temat najlepszego frameworka MVC JavaScript - AngularJS. Podczas warsztatów zaimplementujemy nowoczesną aplikację społecznościową. Wykorzystamy najważniejsze elementy AngularJS, przedstawimy jego zalety, oraz prostotę implementacji. Jezeli chcesz sie dowiedziec, czym jest AngularJS, zanim spedzisz z nami cala sobote, przyjdz na spotkanie przedwarsztatowe: http://www.meetup.com/GDG-Krakow/events/134710092/

Dla kogo?
 Warsztaty te dedykujemy programistom JavaScript posiadającym doświadczenie w tworzeniu aplikacji webowych, pragnących poznać lub udoskonalić swoje umiejętności. Nie wymagamy znajomości AngularJS, natomiast sam język Javascript nie powinien w żaden sposób ograniczać uczestników. Znajomość domknięć, obiektowości czy prototypów jest niezbędna. Warsztaty polecamy też doświadczonym programistom Backbone, EmberJS, oraz innych popularnych rozwiązań JavaScript MVC. Liczymy na owocną dyskusję.

Wymagania
Wymagamy zainstalowanego node.js (http://nodejs.org/) wraz z managerem npm. Niezbędny też będzie edytor JavaScript HTML (IntelliJ, Netbeans, Sublime 2). Wykorzystamy engine templateowy - Jade (http://jade-lang.com/). Przyda się też znajomość prototypów, obiektowości i domknięć Javascript.

AngularJS
Więcej informacji o frameworku znajdziesz tutaj: http://angularjs.org/

Program warsztatów
1. Wprowadzenie do AngularJS. Struktura aplikacji i Dependency Injection.
2. Testowanie przy pomocy Karma i node.js
3. Formularze i zastowanie filtrów.
4. Integracja z zewnętrznymi bibliotekami.
5. Tworzenie niezaleznych komponentow z zastosowaniem dyrektyw oraz komunikacja miedzy nimi.
6. Komunikacja realtime z serwerem.

Co jeszcze?
Osiem godzin, sześć wykładów i zaawansowany portal społecznościowy do napisania. Podczas krótkich przerw podyskutujemy o dobrych praktykach javascriptowych.

Dla uczestników przewidziana jest pizza.

Wstęp wolny.

name: Android Tech Talks #3

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
Android Tech Talks wraca z wakacji z nowej formie. Tym razem zapraszamy Was na spotkanie w formie ogólnej dyskusji, gdzie każdy z nas będzie mógł podzielić się swoimi doświadczeniami.

Temat to: Android a baza danych. Jak to zrobić dobrze?

Standardowym wzorcem komunikacji z bazą danych w Androidzie jest ContentProvider opakowywujący połączenie do SQLite. Co jednak zrobić, czy wraz z rozrostem naszej aplikacji nasz ContentProvider puchnie do niebotycznych rozmiarów? Jak wyeliminować gigantyczny switch-case po wyniku UriMatchera? Jak dobierać się do danych z poziomu naszych Fragmentów / Aktywności - czy Cursor otrzymany z CursorLoadera zadowala nas wystarczająco? Może jakiś ORM - ale co wtedy z obserwowaniem zawartości, wydajnością na starszych modelach?

Masz jakiś pomysł? Chcesz się podzielić rozwiązaniem, które zastosowałeś w swojej aplikacji? Zapraszamy!

Agenda

18:30 - 18:40 - Jerzy Chałupski - krótkie wprowadzenie do problemu.

name: haXe i OpenFL - Jak i czy, robić w tym gry?

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:

Podczas spotkania pokaże jak uniknać najpopularniejszych błedów, zaprezęntuje możliwości języka haXe, przygotuje w pełni dzialajacy projekt multiplatformowej gry oraz omówie jak ją debugować.

Prezentacja bedzie w szczególnosci dotyczyć tworzenia gier na platformy mobilne, android, iOS i Blackberry. Powinna również dać pogląd na to jak haXe użyc do tworzenia innych projektów - aplikacji na komputery stacjonarne czy stron www (backendu i frontendu).

Do tej pory w haXe powstal m.inn. Rymdkapsel ( http://rymdkapsel.com/ ) i Paper Please ( http://dukope.com/ ) - Twoja gra może byc kolejna.

description:

name: Chrome Extensions workshop

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
W ramach noworocznych postanowien postanowilem w koncu zrealizowac pomysl z ktorym nosze sie juz od dluzszego czasu - przeprowadzenie workshop'ow z tworzenia rozszerzen do Chrome'a.

Intro
Dodatki do przegladarek pozwalaja m.i. na:
- modyfikacje strony ktora wlasnie przegladamy (n.p. Adblock, Steak for Gmail),
- wyroznienie istotnych dla nas informacji (n.p. Google Mail Checker),
- integracje z popularnymi serwisami (n.p. Evernote, Amazon, Ebay),
- ulatwienie nam pracy z przegladarka (n.p. Too many tabs, Click & Clean, Session Buddy) czy
- zwiekszenie jej mozliwosci (n.p. Dev HTTP Client, DevTools Terminal).
Stworzenie wlasnego dodatku jest bardzo proste - wystarczy podstawowa wiedza z zakresu technologii webowych (JavaScript/HTML/CSS) i ciekawy pomysl.

Workshop
4 godzinny event podczas ktorego zbudujemy od podstaw proste rozszerzenie do Chroma. Zaczniemy od 30min wprowadzenia w formie prezentacji, reszte czasu poswiecajac na czesc praktyczna ktora bedzie podzielona na kilka etapow (checkpoint'ow). Od uczestnikow wymagany bedzie laptop z aktualna wersja Chroma, podstawowa wiedza z zakresu JavaScriptu/HTMLa/CSSa oraz edytor/IDE (WebStorm, Sublime, NetBeans). Przez cale warsztaty na sali beda dostepne dwie osoby ktore beda w stanie pomoc uczestnikom z zadaniem. 

The workshop can be provided in english, so please join us even if you're not speaking polish :-)

Konrad Dzwinel o sobie: 
W przeciagu ostatnich trzech lat napisalem kilka dodatkow, zarowno otwartych ( https://chrome.google.com/webstore/search-extensions/Konrad%20Dzwinel ) jak i zamknietych (wewnetrzne potrzeby firmy). Sa to glownie narzedzia dla fron-end developerow ktorych mi samemu brakowalo. W 2011, "Context" - jeden z moich dodatkow, wygral nagrode specjalna w konkursie organizowanym przez Google ( https://sites.google.com/site/polandchromecomp/wyniki ).
Poza tym, udzielam sie aktywnie w temacie dodatkow do Chrome'a na StackOverflow jak rowniez sledze i testuje zmainy w API.

name: Web Analytics Wednesdays Kraków #1

description:

name: Google Cloud Platform Event
description:
!!! This is not a GDG, but Google event - we just spread the word !!!

Google Cloud Platform events in Poland
Google’s Cloud Platform Developer events are coming to Poland. On June 5th in Warsaw and on June 17th in Krakow, we will be talking about new approaches to computing that enable your apps to move beyond traditional divisions of PaaS and IaaS. We will also show how we are building an awesome developer experience to make you more productive.
Warsaw - June 5th, Krakow - June 17th
No matter what Cloud supplier you're using at the moment, this is a great opportunity to see behind the scenes of the world's biggest cloud, and engage with the Google's Cloud Platform team.

Event will last for ~3 hours and is free of charge. Food and drinks will be provided. There will be additional time for networking with Google Cloud engineers as well as opportunity to join Early Access / Trusted Testers program.

We hope to see you there.
Dawid Ostrowski, Developer Relations Program Manager

Register here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Hch-DYDTtXdNzrr3eLmcW7DKYB1gSCWrgu5_mOkMclY/viewform?fbzx=-9129473776758828165

name: Frontend #3: Hybrid apps / Structuring large Angular apps / Intro to grunt.js

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
Zapraszamy wszystkich zainteresowanych na trzy front-end'owe prezentacje:

"SPAR Handleliste - case study hybrydowej aplikacji mobilnej" - Konrad Dzwinel - wstęp do tego czym są aplikacje hybrydowe, jakie są ich plusy i minusy w stosunku do innych rozwiązań, jak się zabrać za ich tworzenie oraz demo i lessons learned z projektu w którym pracuje od roku.

"Structuring large AngularJS apps" - Kenneth Lynne - Kenneth jest naszym guru Angular'owym w Making Waves i twórcą generator-angular-xl . Opowie o tym jakie jest jego podejście do budowania dużych aplikacji.

"Intro to front-end automation using grunt.js" - Dominik Prokop - Dominik jest front-end developerem który na codzień pracuje przy projektach dla FIFA. Jego prezentacja jest szybkim i przyjemny wstępem do grunt'a: setup, możliwości oraz best practises.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Prezentacje, ze względu na to że Kenneth nie mówi po polsku, będą w języku angielskim.

name: Google I/O Extended 2014 [1/2]
description:
Google I/O to doroczna konferencja poświęcona technologiom webowym i mobilnym. Tegoroczne I/O (7 edycja konferencji organizowanej przez Google) odbędzie się w centrum konferencyjnym Moscone Center w San Francisco w dniach 25-26 czerwca. Oprócz 6000 osób na miejscu w San Francisco konferencję mogą śledzić na żywo tysiące osób poprzez live-streaming.

W tym roku Google Developers Group Kraków wraz z hub:raum Kraków organizują I/O Extended, podczas którego można będzie obejrzeć streaming na żywo z tej największej organizowanej przez Google konferencji. W programie, oprócz transmisji najciekawszych sesji, wystąpienia zaproszonych gości oraz konkursy. Do tego smaczna pizza, napoje, przekąski i mnóstwo dobrej zabawy.

Program konferencji: https://www.google.com/events/io

Oprócz oglądania prezentacji odbywających się w Kalifornii będziemy mieć również lokalną:

- ~21:00 - Marta Ryłko - Best UI for Data Analysis

Zapraszamy!

name: GDG Show&Tell: Google Apps and Android Family

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
Nie ma, że wakacje? Ano nie ma, bo nie ma wakacji od dowiadywania się nowych rzeczy!

Spędźcie z nami sobotni poranek, w trochę jednak wakacyjnej atmosferze: oprócz prezentacji Jakuba Kołakowskiego (GDG Warszawa) o "Aplikacjach Google jako rozszerzalnych narzędziach do współpracy wieloosobowej" (czyli np. do planowania wakacyjnych pikników ze znajomymi) będzie też okazja, aby pobawić się gadżetami przywiezionymi wprost z Google I/O: smartwatchem LG G działającym na Android Wear oraz ADT-1 z Android TV. 

Zapraszamy!

Event odbędzie się w języku polskim.

***

No such thing as holiday? Duh! There's no holiday from learning new things!

Spend the Saturday morning with us, in a bit of a holiday atmosphere though: in addition to Jakub Kołakowski's (GDG Warsaw) presentation about "Google Apps as an extensible tool for multi-user collaboration" (e.g. planning a holiday picnic with your friends) you will have a chance to play with some cool gadgets straight from the Google I/O conference: the Android Wear powered LG G Smartwatch and ADT-1 Android TV.

Be there or be square!

Event will be held in polish, but as far as we're concerned you can sweet-talk the devices in binary code. 

If you attended, attend or would like to attend our events and be a part of our community please click I'm A Member on ourdevelopers.google.com profile.

name: Android Tech Talks #8 - big IOSched hacking

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
*** REJESTRACJA STARTUJE WE WTOREK, 5 SIERPNIA o 19, LICZBA MIEJSC OGRANICZONA ***

Emocje po tegorocznym I/O już powoli opadają. Wielu z nas podczas trwania wydarzenia korzystało z dedykowanej aplikacji Google obsługującą to wydarzenie - I/O Sched.

Jak co roku, również kod wersji z 2014 został udostępniony publicznie i jest dostępny na GitHubie: https://github.com/google/iosched

Zapraszamy Was na Android Tech Talks #8, podczas którego wspólnie będziemy ulepszać kod ioscheda!

Podczas wydarzenia podzielimy się na grupy, każda będzie odpowiedzialna za refaktoryzację określonej części aplikacji. Po zakończeniu pracy każda grupa dostanie kilka minut czasu programowego na zaprezentowanie swoich ulepszeń.

Agenda:

18:00 - Punktualne rozpoczęcie wydarzenia, krótki wstęp

18:05 - 20:30 - Hacking!

20:30 - 21:00 - Prezentacje grup 

Uważasz, że biblioteka którą napisałeś idealnie wpasuje się w problem realizowany przez ioschedzie? Znasz narzędzie, które pozwoli wykonywać jakąś operację sprawniej bądź czytelniej? A może po prostu masz pomysł na generalny refaktoring części aplikacji?

Liczymy nas Was i mamy nadzieję, że samo wydarzenie zaowocuje kilkoma soczystymi pull-requestami do projektu! Kto wie, może kod który napiszesz tego dnia będzie napędzać przyszłoroczny IOSched?

Zapraszamy!

name: Web Analytics Wednesday Kraków #4

venue.name: GEK - Google for Entrepreneurs in Kraków

description:
Web Analytics Wednesday is the world's only social networking event for web analytics professionals. Web Analytics Wednesday is a global effort to put "faces with names" and to get local members of the web analytics community networking.

So... 
if you want to learn more from data about your site 
if you want to talk about web analytics

...reserve 15th October evening and join us!

It will be fourth Web Analytics Wednesday in Cracow.

Agenda:

6:30 - 6:45 - sign in & networking

6:45 - 7:15 - Metaphor & design patterns (Hubert Turaj, Edisonda)

Kluczem do zaprojektowania aplikacji, która będzie efektywna w działaniu, ale jednocześnie prosta i elegancka są dwie rzeczy - doskonałe zrozumienie problemu, który aplikacji rozwiązuje i znalezienie sprytnego rozwiązania. Innymi słowy - wymyślenia ciekawej interakcji, która tłumaczy się sama przez się.

W trakcie prezentacji zaprezentowane zostanie kilka przykładów aplikacji mobilnych i desktopowych, które  wykorzystując ciekawe rozwiązania dla problemów, które wcześniej były prezentowane w sposób trudny. Zajrzymy też do kuchni projektowej, gdzie będzie można przyjrzeć się narzędziom projektowym, które pomagają dochodzić do eleganckich rozwiązań w sposób systematyczny, a nie tylko przypadkowy.

7:15 - 7:30 - Q&A

7:30 - 8:00 -  Notes on 'How to Measure Anything: Finding the Value of Intangibles in Business ' by D.W. Hubbard (Marta Ryłko, Brainly)

How to measure customers satisfaction? Product or Content Quality? What should be considered before even starting the measurement? In his book, Hubbard addresses some terrific subjects concerning measurements and I want to share with you my highlights.

8:00 - Q&A, networking

After meetup we will go to one of pubs to speak in less formal atmosphere :)

Presentations will be realized in Polish.

Please comment if you have something you want to cover! If you want to make a presentation - contact with Michal Brys.

About speakers:

Hubert Turaj - Swoją przygodę z User Experience rozpoczął w 2005 roku w Oslo, gdzie przebywał na stypendium na tamtejszym Uniwersytecie. Po powrocie rozpoczął pracę w norweskiej agencji Making Waves, gdzie pracując jako projektant, a następnie kierując działem UX w jej krakowskim oddziale, promował zagadnienia użyteczności na polskim rynku.

Jest autorem wielu branżowych raportów na temat użyteczności i standardów polskich serwisów internetowych (ubezpieczycieli, banków, firm turystycznych, urzędów miejskich, polskiego e-commerce).

Wykładał na tematy związane z UX na Wyższej Szkole Europejskiej i Akademii Pedagogicznej w Krakowie oraz wielu konferencjach dla różnych branż.

Współzałożyciel studio EDISONDA. 

Marta Ryłko - I'm a beginner Data Analyst in Brainly, where we reach 33 mln users monthly across 35 countries. Brainly is the world's largest crowd learning network for students, to share their knowledge and skills with each other.

name: GDG DevFest Poland 2014
description:
A day full of speeches about newest technologies presented by European speakers. There will also be a soft skills set with practical tips & tricks regarding leadership, communication & design.

Conference includes 3 workshops of 1,5 hour each, related to topics introduced in presentations. That will be a great occasion to try and develop something new using up to date technologies under the supervision of experts.

During the conference you will have a lot of occasions to meet interesting people from Poland and Europe. Conference will end with an afterparty in one of Krakow’s clubs.

Registration via Meetup is not enough, go to http://devfest2014.pl/ and register!

--

DevFest Poland to dzień pełen prezentacji prowadzonych przez znanych europejskich speakerów na temat najnowszych technologii. Jednak nie tylko tematy technologiczne będą obecne na konferencji - możecie spodziewać się również prezentacji związanych z komunikacją, lidershipem i designem. 

Podczas konferencji zaplanowane są 3 warsztaty - każdy trwający 1,5h. Będą one dotykać tematów poruszanych wcześniej na konferencji. Warsztaty to doskonała okazja żeby pod okiem ekspertów spróbować budowy nowej aplikacji/narzędzia/strony z użyciem nowoczesnych technologii.

DevFest Poland to także świetna okazja by poznać interesujących ludzi (m.in. programistów, testerów, designerów) z całej Polski i Europy. Po konferencji zapraszamy na afterparty w jednym z krakowskich klubów.

Rejestracja za pośrednictwem Meetup jest niewystarczająca - zarejestruj się na http://devfest2014.pl/

name: I/O Extended 2015 Kraków
description:
Nie możecie pojawić się na Google I/O osobiście? Obejrzyjcie z nami streaming, przy okazji słuchając ciekawych talków przy pizzy i piwie.

Między Keynotem, a resztą wystąpień będziemy mieć dwie prezentacje:

1. Mirek Stanek Dependency Injection With Dagger 2

O Mirku: Nazywam się Mirek Stanek, jestem wielkim pasjonatem technologii mobilnych, na zmianę programuję Androida i iOSa, a na co dzień jestem Head of Mobile w firmie Azimo. Prowadzę bloga http://frogermcs.github.io/, tweetuję o mobile, od czasu do czasu tworzę open source. Jestem wielkim fanem IoT.

2. Konrad Dzwinel Chrome DevTools od środka - Debugging Protocol

O Konradzie: Konrad jest programistą z siedmioletnim doświadczeniem. Początkowo zajmował się on głównie technologiami back-end'owymi, obecnie pracuje jako front-end developer w Brainly. Na codzień zajmuje się dużymi aplikacjami JavaScript i organizuje wewnętrzne szkolenia. Po godzinach rozwija rozszerzenia do przeglądarki Chrome, eksperymentuje z rozmaitymi technologiami front-end'owymi, prowadzi warsztaty i prezentacje. name: The WebView Role in Hybrid Applications Development
description:
Abstract: As of Android 4.4, the WebView class is based on the Chromium web browser. As a result of that, many of the difficulties we faced when developing hybrid applications for the android platform no longer exist. The meeting will start with overviewing the fundamental concept of hybrid applications. We will learn how to write code in JavaScript that while running inside the WebView it calls functions we define in Java and vice versa. We will see how we can debug code in JavaScript running inside the WebView and go through the many advanced capabilities we can enjoy when using the WebView class. In addition, we will understand how PhoneGap works and what might be the best practice for using it.

Speaker: Haim Michael (Israel) has more than 18 years of experience in software development, training & consulting. During the years, Haim has taught both academic and professional courses on C\C++, Java, Java EE, PHP, Scala, Android, HTML5, .NET, JavaScript and UML. Haim was one of the first software developers worldwide who started to develop mobile applications for the J2ME platform. During those years, Zindell Technologies has developed more than 200 titles for mobile telephones, both games and applications, and published them worldwide working together with more than 300 companies all over the world. As of 2007, Haim focuses on endless self studying and teaching following his passion for software development and publishes his over 200 free online courses about software development through http://abelski.lifemichael.com . Haim’s software development technical channel at http://www.youtube.com/lifemichael has nearly 3 million views. Haim is a PHP Zend Certified Engineer, OMG Certified UML Professional, Certified Java Professional and a Certified Java EE Web Components Developer. In addition, Haim Michael holds MBA (cumlaude) from Tel-Aviv University. More info about Haim Michael and about the software development training & consulting services he provides can be found at http://www.lifemichael.com .

name: "Telling Our Story" International Women's Day Celebration
description:
Lets celebrate all together this year's International Women'sDay with 3 totally different talks. Hoping everyone will find something interesting here:

• "Scaling yourself up - from individual contributor to a team leader" by Joanna Chwastowska
When we grow as engineers we usually focus first on expanding our technical skills. But sooner or later there comes a moment that we reach our full capacity - there's only so much code we can add within 24 hours, and so much we alone can move the project forward. How do we increase our impact then?

In this talk Joanna will touch on what makes a great tech leader and manager, how managing engineers is different than any other management, and how one can grow to build and sustain a happy and productive technical team. 

From an engineer, to a Tech/Lead Manager, to a Site Lead - after 9 years of working at Google in Krakow, more than year ago Joanna started to build the engineering office for Spring, NY based e-commerce startup. 

From the tech side, she was creating the web and mobile applications for years. From the management side she led various teams, local and distributed, small and large, working with all sorts of engineers to change the world. She founded (and closed;) her own startup, which taught her a lesson too. Passionate about people, team dynamics, and how we help each other grow. 

As a mentor she supported various non-profit technology initiatives such as Tech2Empower in Ukraine, digital poverty mapping of the poor areas in Philippines, and co-organized Campus for Mums in Cracow. 

• "Machine Learning is redefining industries" by Łukasz Siatka
Complex machine learning models, such as deep neural networks, have recently achieved great predictive successes for visual object recognition, speech perception, language modeling, and information retrieval. These predictive successes are enabled by automatically learning expressive features from the data. Typically, these learned features are a priori unknown, difficult to engineer by hand, and hard to interpret. This presentation is about the industries that machine learning redefines.

Łukasz - student of Jagiellonian University, Machine Learning Study Group organizer, activist and entrepreneur. Every single day he approaches the age when most people believe that they still have enough time to do everything they want. He does not know how to live in illusions and appreciates the efficiency and streamlining of processes. He is interested in IT, psychology, multitasking optimisation methods. He is expressing himself by being an audio engineer and events organizer, as well as changing the world with various NGOs. 

• "What am I doing here? - Women in IT" by Monika Braun

This will be a story about experience and knowledge sharing. The story about the most important persons, challenges and skills which can help to achieve your own goals – be the best you!

This is my own story from Trainer | Task Manger| Agile coach | Quality Manager| Scrum anti-purist |People Manager| IT Team member| woman (choose the best one) perspective. So it will be a short story about the passions and different (self) management techniques from some woman who live in IT world and love it!

Monika - many passions aggregated in one person: keen QA, agile believer, propagator of development soft skills in IT and lover of working with people.

Coach of quality assurance and testing methodologies, that teaches new testers and test managers for a few years, during the workshops, trainings, as well as on public and private universities.
Agile consultant and trainer, scrum anti-purist and peer-to-peer motivation passionate.She loves agile, because it changes the way of thinking and motivates to look for a business value through the prism of people who makes up this values. She believes that it allows to make great things in a team and derive satisfaction from achieving goals.

Coach of soft skills dedicated to IT, that developed, for her own projects and project teams, the training program focused on supporting IT geeks in daily cooperation with the rest of the world. Based on business cases dedicated to specific roles, she empowers people's skills such as communication, assertiveness, negotiation and team building.
Combining agile methodologies with quality assurance and focusing on people she supports the transformations of processes and teams, increasing effectiveness and engagement in achieving project goals.Always passionately shares her experience and knowledge, supporting teams in discovering their abilities and finding new effective methods of incorporation of good practices in daily work.

name: Android Tech Talks
description:
Android Tech Talks are coming back after a long break. As usual, we start at 7, and finish ~10ish.


Agenda:

Mike Wolfson - Google Developer Expert, Android - Mastering Material Motion

"Creating apps with effective motion hasn't always been simple, but I have learned some techniques to make it easy. Come to this session where I will show you how to use touch feedback, transitions and animations to make your applications come alive with effective motion and be more enjoyable for your users."

Wojtek Kaliciński - Developer Advocate, Google - (Extended!) performance tooling

"Perf matters, and this year Google Play and Android Studio have delivered all-new tools to help diagnose performance issues to keep your apps fast and smooth." - this is an extended version of Wojtek's GDD talk, expect this one to be led in a live-demo/hands-on way.

Florina Muntenescu - Developer Advocate, Google - Data Persistence in Android: There's Room For Improvement<a href="https://twitter.com/FMuntenescu"></a>

"At Google I/O we launched Room: a persistence component designed to make your life easier when working with SQLite databases on Android. Entities and data access objects are defined using annotations, your queries are now checked at compile time and the database migrations are easy to implement. In this talk you’ll find out whether you should or not integrate Room in your project. You’ll learn how Room works, how it handles multi-threading, how to write queries and work with different return types, how to migrate your database, and finally, how to test your code."

Walmyr Carvalho - Android Developer @ 99, Google Developer Expert, Android - Kotlin in production

"At 99, one of the biggest ride hailing companies in Brazil, we're using Kotlin in production since the last year. On this talk I want to show some basic info and overview about the language, show some real production code made with Kotlin and remove the fears of using this language in production applications."

We start with pizza at 7, so don't be late!

After that we will have a chance to see some raw knowledge about Rx!

Bio:
Dmitry Saviuk and Łukasz Matysik
Android guys from the IG.

Title:
How 2 Rx

Description:
Dealing with async code in (really) reactive way - how to use RxJava and not hurt yourself.
Summary of what we have learned during last 2 years of development.

Last but not least!

Bio:
Grzegorz Wikiera and Piotr Ślesarew
Mobile guys from the GP core team.

Title:
DSL like a boss

Description:
Building UI testing approach can be tough. During the presentation, we would like to share our experience with building a common solution for both Android and iOS platforms. Real case studies, solutions, and code samples. Hope you will enjoy it!

See you soon Geeks!

name: Android Tech Talks #19
description:
The next Android Tech Talks meetup is here!

Three presentations this time:

We will start getting some knowledge about TensorFlow.

Bio:
Mateusz Budzar
Android Developer for over 4 years living in Wroclaw. He works at Droids On Roids on a daily basis. Enthusiast of clean code, speaker, blogger, co-organizer of GDG Wrocław and TOAST - Android Developers Meetup, basketball amateur, karateka, bookworm. Recently, he became very interested in the subject of Machine Learning and is developing in this direction. From tomorrow, he intends to eat healthy. His motto is "Hop, hop, buf, buf and act.

Title:
TensorFlow - Hot or not?

Description:
During the presentation, we'll learn how to use the TensorFlow library on Android. We will discuss the whole code on the example of the ‘Hot or not’ app. The app itself is pretty simple - we’re taking a picture and the app tells us if it’s hot or not. We will explain what the classifier is, how it was created, and how to create our own without creating it completely from scratch. We will also learn how to optimize our classifier to better suit the needs of mobile applications. After this presentation you’ll be able to create your own app with the use of TensorFlow.

After that we will have a chance to see some raw knowledge about building big apps from small apps in Android!

Bio:
Mateusz Herych + Jakub Białkowski
Mateusz and Kuba work at IG, where they are leading two of IG's Android teams.

Our app was built over 7 years, by dozens of different developers across 3 different countries. Countless amount of features and fast pace over time did put us in a situation where our app was a giant monolithic monster, where changes are risky and even incremental compilation took like ages. This year however, by trying to accomplish a challenge of forking our main codebase into 3 different trading platforms, we managed to split it down into the feature-scoped modules, that are reusable across different end-user products that we maintain.

Title:
Android LEGO - building big apps from small apps

Description:
Hey Android dev out there! Ever found yourself in a situation when your app is a giant monolith project, where everything is coupled together, changes are risky and the incremental build takes ages? Yeah, so did we. Let us tell you how we solved this problem at IG.

Last but not least!

Bio:
Jarosław Michalik
Android developer for about 2 years. Works on IoT and telemedicine projects. In the meantime he supports students developer group on AGH and plays volleyball as a right side hitter.

Title:
Effective testing with Spek

Description:
I will share some thoughts about Spek - JVM specification framework. Don't Repeat Yourself principle applies to your test codebase too - I will show some examples and discuss how writing specifications improves your developer experience.

See you soon Geeks!

name: Android Tech Talks #20
description:
The next Android Tech Talks meetup is here!

Two presentations this time:

We will start getting some knowledge about Flutter.

Bio:
Paulina Szklarska
Paulina is Android Developer at Droids On Roids for 4 years. She is actively involved in Android community, co-organizing TOAST, one of the biggest meetups series for Android Developers in Wrocław, engaged into GDG Wrocław & Women Techmakers community and blogging in her free time. Her passion is traveling around the world.

Title:
Flutter - How to make a beautiful app in an hour?

Description:
Announced at Google I/O ’17 Flutter is a new open source library for creating cross-platform mobile applications with beautiful UI. Is it something new? Is it needed? Will this be a future? In this presentation I'd like to give an overview of approach in creating mobile applications in Flutter, point advantages of this solution and present example of application. After this talk you'll be able to face a question - is Flutter something for you?

After that we will have a chance to get familiar with WireMock and make our tests great again!

Bio:
Michał Bogus
I work for the company called FarmaProm. I have been Android Developer for 3 years now. I have participated in almost 15 projects with many different methodologies, aproaches and range of target in terms of users (hundreds to millions daily users). For now I am trying to develop my own library for BDD testing.

Title:
Quick REST architecture + WireMock - make testing of REST great again

Description:
This talk will be all about clean architecture in terms of "networking" section of your application, I want to show you how we can keep really clean and robust unit tests for nearly every part of your newly created REST models. I will also talk how to deal with custom created errors from REST via Rx and Retrofit. There is also great deal of work in terms of automated tests that uses all of these endpoints, and for that I also want to talk about precious WireMock, how we can approach using this library and how to create tests that all of us can read.

See you soon Geeks!

name: Let's talk about AI
description:
We are happy to announce that three amazing professionals joined our mission as speakers to present you a bit of the Artificial Intelligence universe from their perspective.
The event will take place on the 7th of August at 19 at Barka, Krakow.
You will have the chance to hear each speaker for 30 minutes and be involved in the Q&A section afterward, we will make sure we have breaks and time for networking at the end so you will be able to interact with everyone at the event!

**UPDATE**
Ladies & Gents, lots of things happened during the last two weeks since we published the event. And even before that, since we have been shaping the details for this event since 2 months ago.
What happened so far? Well, some unfortunate life events made not possible for the 3 planned speakers to come to our event. Still, they helped us to find interested people willing to share their knowledge and we appreciate that!
So, be ready for tomorrow to meet Michał Warchoł, Christian Merkwirth, and Michał Soboszek.
We will have a wonderful summer evening at the riverside listening to experts talking about AI.

Let us present you to our speakers:

• Michał Warchoł
He serves as a Director of Ardigen AI Labs. Prior to joining Ardigen, Michał co-founded DeepArt, a company providing novel image processing algorithms based on deep learning. He did a PhD in Statistics at the Institute of Statistics, Biostatistics and Actuarial Sciences at Université Catholique de Louvain in Belgium. Part of his research program was conducted at the Department of Statistics at Columbia University in New York.

• Christian Merkwirth
He is a Machine Learning Architect and Backend Engineer at NAUTO, a Palo Alto startup. Prior to this, he worked on various projects in Google, including the Google Accelerated Science (GAS) team. Christian’s interest in Statistics, Machine Learning, and Dynamical Systems began 20 years ago when working on his PhD in Nonlinear Physics. His expertise combines various fields of advanced numerical methods, including Statistical Learning, Time Series Forecasting and High Performance Computing. Putting those approaches into practical use is a main motivation for Christian.

• Michał Soboszek
Student of Computational Mathematics at Jagiellonian University. Co-founder of Machine Learning Study Group (MLSG) - an initiative promoting Machine Learning and its development. Deeply interested in theoretical aspects of Machine Learning. Currently works at Lonsley.

We invite everyone who wants to build or expand their knowledge in the field of Artificial Intelligence!
→ The registration will be through this meetup event.
Remember - we have only 100 seats available - you need to be in the list of attendees.
We kindly ask you to please update your RSVP if you know that you can not make it.

Last but not least, big thanks to our partners #omgkrk, Women in AI and Women in Technology!

If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us.

We hope to see you there!

WTM & GDG Krakow

https://www.facebook.com/gdgkrk/

name: Android Tech Talks #21
description:
The next Android Tech Talks meetup is here!

Two presentations this time:

We will start getting some knowledge about Git best practises.

Bio:
Filip Misztal
Android Developer since 2013, working in Schibsted Tech Polska. In love with delivering value to People, testing freak, Kotlin enthusiast, Git fan, that is taking his first steps as a speaker. Sailor & tourist after stepping away from a desk.

Title:
Create significant history - every day

Description:
During my presentation, I want to share some good practices regarding git usage in a long-lasting project. I will go through some real-life scenarios to show You that with a small effort you and your colleagues can get much more from your project `git log`.

After that we will have a chance to get familiar with AndroidKeystore to keep our secrets!

Bio:
Tomek Masłoń
Software engineer with 10 years of experience.
Althought, at work happens to write code for bigger machines, his passion has always been pocket size devices.
With strong embedded background currently enjoying implementing more user level interface for Android.
He touched some aspects of data security on smartcards and mobile devices.

Title:
Keeping your secrets - What AndroidKeystore can or can’t do for you?

Description:
In recent years millions of people have been affected by hackers who had leaked their personal data into the Web.
It's not always a good idea to carefree upload our data into a cloud and trust security that it provides.
We as developers should take a use of features that are supplied by the system that we work on.
I will start with presenting the evolution of data security on Android. We will discuss hardware backed security in old times and what is used currently.
I'd also like to familiarize you with Trusted Execution Environment(TEE) and how the system supports it.
Finally we will take a look at more practical use of what AndroidKeystore API has to offer and what is the alternative.

See you soon Geeks!

name: Recognize text in images with ML kit for Firebase
description:
The next GDG meetup is here!

One *workshop* this time:

Recognize text in images with ML kit for Firebase.

Bio:
Jeff Huleatt
Jeff is a Developer Advocate for Firebase at Google. He’s excited about helping app developers make cool stuff (whether that’s on web, Android, or iOS). For the past two years, Jeff has helped run Firebase support, so if you have questions about any Firebase product, this is your chance to ask! Prior to Google, he was a software engineer working mostly on JavaScript web apps for financial institutions. Jeff has a Bachelor’s in Computer Science and Applied Sciences in Engineering from Rutgers University.

During this meetup, you will learn how to use ML Kit for Firebase to easily add advanced machine learning capabilities to your app. It's a great opportunity to ask Jeff questions about Firebase and give direct feedback about Firebase products too!

You will learn how to:
• How to add ML Kit for Firebase to your Android app
• How to use on-device text recognition in ML Kit to find text in images
• How to use cloud text recognition in ML Kit to enable more advanced use cases, such as recognition of non-Latin alphabet
• When it is appropriate to use on-device vs cloud text recognition

description:
The next Android Tech Talks meetup is here!

*This time we make an exception, and one presentation will be in polish language*

Two presentations this time:

We will start getting some knowledge about bad APIs and how to deal with it and stay sane.

*(EN)*
Bio:
Jerzy Chałupski
Mobile developer since ancient pre-Android times, currently thinking big about Android development at IG. Kotlin aficionado, occasional blogger, bookworm. In his free time enjoys nerdy games with some coding elements.

Title:
How to deal with bad APIs?

Description:
Designing a good API is *hard*, probably harder than most people, including API designers, realise. It means, there's a very good chance you either had to work with a bad API already, or you will work with one in the near future.

In this talk I'll show a few common issues with bad APIs and show how to deal with it and stay sane.

***

After that we will have a chance to hear real life tips about having your own apps in Google Play!

*(PL)*

Bruno Wieczorek

Miłosz Lewandowski
Android developer interested in delivering well-thought solutions and amazing user experience. Currently working for Miquido on the self-service app for one of the biggest polish telcos. In the free time watching tons of arthouse movies.

Title:
Flutter ♥ Firebase. How to quickly prepare a complete mobile solution?

Description:
In July 2018, I've prepared an app for my friends and me to share opinions on the movies we were watching at one of the film festivals in Poland. That was the first time I've used Flutter, and I've chosen Firebase for authentication and storing the data.

name: Android Tech Talks #23
description:
Hey there,

Let's meet again. Two presentations so far, but C4P is still open - let us know if you would like to speak.

We will start getting Smali knowledge about Kotlin Coroutines and how do they work under the hood.

Bio:
Aleksander Piotrowski
Father of two beautiful chihuahuas, Android dev in free time.

Title:
How do coroutines REALLY work underneath.

Description:
In my presentation we will look under the hood of coroutines to see how they are implemented. We will see what magic is being used by coroutines (if any).

After that our local Android GDE will demystify Android memory management!

Bio:
Mateusz Herych
Android Tech Lead at IG, GDE for Android, father of twins and an avid fan of rail transportation

Title:
Android memory management - how, when and why does Android decide to kill your app.

Description:
Android is often ruthless towards our apps. As soon as the user puts them in the background, we suddenly join the list of apps to kill. While we all know about this, making sure our code supports post-process death resurrection isn't a trivial task. Attend this talk to learn: - Best practices for handling process death - Myth of Don't Keep Activities - What Android handles for you for free - ... and what it doesn't. - How to rebuild the state of your application-scoped/staticly-kept app components - and how to properly test it

As always, pizza & beer/drinks are included.

See you there!

name: Mini Design sprint:  A taste of Google design sprint methodology.
description:
Mini Design sprint: A taste of Google design sprint methodology.

Design Sprints are the fastest way to solve big challenges together, find out if a product is worth developing, if a feature is worth the effort, or if you're on the right track. Don’t invest months of endless meetings and delays, invest a few days. Sprints Reduce time, cost, and risk.

The sprint is a 2-3 days process for answering critical business & product questions through design, prototyping, and testing. We are all Certified Google Sprint Masters and our sprint methods are based on Google Ventures Designs Sprint. The sprint were validated and enhanced by Google with over 150 successful companies.

During the workshop we will understand the sprint methodology basic and try out some hands on fun tasks of solving a product problem, together.

Adi Mazor Kario, MSc Cognitive Science, GDE, Sprint Master, Experience Expert.
Adi is a Senior UX expert, Product and Voice Designer. She is also a Google mentor and expert in the future of technology. She is the owner and CEO of Wizard Product Design & UX.
With more than 17 years of experience, Adi created projects for fortune 500 companies, like Intel and IBM in parallel to smaller companies and startups by guiding them from idea and strategy to an amazing user experience that sells more.
Since 2013 Adi has been teaching and practicing design sprints and she loved the methodology and its impact on products.
https://www.linkedin.com/in/adimazorkario/

The workshop will be conducted by Adi in English.
It will take place in Sabre Poland, Wadowicka 6D gateways/door 9.
We only have 23 places available, registration is through Meetup and it will be open on Tuesday 15th of January at 10am.
IMPORTANT!!! it is extremely important for the people who RSVPed Yes to confirm and engage with their presence as well as to update the response if something changes!

name: IWD 2019 - Safe Meeting
description:
Do you want to be safe online? Find out how not to be hacked? Get to know interesting stories of cyber attacks?

Women Techmakers and Women in Technology invite you to the first meeting of the Safe Meetings series, which will introduce us to a wide range of IT Security issues. We invite everyone interested - both experienced and interested in this subject.

At the next meeting we will listen about the incidents of cybercriminals, which were not without echoes. We will also celebrate International Women's Day :)

Planned agenda:
18:00-18:10 Welcome

18:10-18:40 Joanna Świątkowska (AGH, CYBERSEC European Cybersecurity Forum, Kościuszki Insitiute) - Women in IT Security

18:40-19:10 Robert Siudak (Kościuszki Institute) - Why not let yourself be hacked?

19:10-19:20 Break

19:20-21:00 Jakub Mrugalski (Niebezpiecznik.pl) - How we stole PLN 13 million from Polish companies - case study

1. Joanna Świątkowska (AGH, CYBERSEC European Cybersecurity Forum, Kościuszki Insitiute) - Women in IT Security
Lecturer, Programme Director and cybersecurity expert. Co-worker of the Center for Cybersecurity and International Relations Studies research team at the University of Florence. Former member [masked]) of the Polish Cyberspace Security Team operating within the National Security Bureau. Former editor-in-chief of the European Cybersecurity Journal [masked]).
Author of numerous publications, reports, analyses and expert comments in the field of security, especially information fight, cybersecurity. She has initiated, implemented and participated in many national and international projects devoted to this subject. She conducts didactic activities related to the area of cyber security. In 2016, she was selected to participate in the International Visitor Leadership Program - Cybersecurity and Government Interoperability (organized by the US Department of State). In 2017 it was entered on the prestigious list of New Europe 100 Challengers 2017 prepared by the Financial Times Res Publica, Google and the International Visegrad Fund.

2. Robert Siudak (Kościuszki Institute) - Why not let yourself be hacked?
What do the American presidential election and the supply of chicken wings to your fast-food have in common? As recent years have shown, in both cases hackers can influence them using not only technology but also the human factor.

3. Jakub Mrugalski (Niebezpiecznik.pl) - How we stole PLN 13 million from Polish companies - case study
Sociotechnical attacks are very different from classical computer intrusions, and unfortunately more and more often they concern Polish companies. When people are the target of attacks, you never know how they will react. Employees have to be ready for everything and make quick decisions. There is no time for victims to consult on security policies, and only common sense can help them. Unfortunately, in stress and fatigue, not everything works as it should....

The event is free of charge, but it is necessary to collect a ticket.

NOTE: In case of ticket collection and resignation from participation in the event, please contact us.

The meeting will be held in Polish.

name: Android Tech Talks #24
description:
Hi geeks,

Let's meet again. Two presentations, lightning talks, fridge full of your favourite beverage and tons of pizzas. Sounds awesome, right?

We will start getting knowledge about Kotlin Detekt and how to create custom plugins tailored to your own needs.

Bio:
Jarosław Michalik
Android developer for about 3 years. Works on IoT and telemedicine projects. In the meantime he supports students developer group on AGH and plays volleyball as a right side hitter.

Title:
Nasty words and how to Detekt them.

Description:
Let any one of you who never put swears in code be the first to throw a stone. Those ugly words may make a mess if they won't be removed before merge. What if user sees some of them?
I will present the story of how swearwords were added to our codebase and case study about finding solution to limit them.
You will learn about creating Detekt plugin and you will see possible options to integrate automated language checks into your development process.

After that Michał will take the stage and show you insights from production application written using React Native!

Bio:
Michał Czernek
After working on multiple native Android applications in Motorola Solutions, Boostcom and DreamLab, I turned into React Native world. Already released first production application in RN, currently helping develop Expo.io in Software Mansion.

Title:
First impressions and second thoughts after releasing React Native app.

Description:
At the end of last year, our team at DreamLab finished working on brand new vod.pl mobile application. It was created for both Android and iOS with React Native framework. I'll be sharing what we've learned along the way, what are our thoughts on this technology and how it performs with real users. Both experienced React Native users and those, who barely know what's that should find something for themselves.

** Lightning talks

Bio:
Jakub Tlałka
Just a regular developer :).

Title:
Are we ready for Gradle Kotlin DSL?

I would like to present Kotlin DSL as a potential replacement for Groovy build scripts. Let's briefly analyse what we can get from Kotlin and how to play with various Gradle Plugins.

See you there!

name: Piszę tekst czy projektuję komunikację? - opowieść o UX writingu
description:
Wykład o UX writingu poprowadzi dla nas Anna Dominika Kwiatkowska. O czym posłuchamy?
Anna opowie między innymi o tym:
🔹czym się różni komunikat sprzedażowy od użytkowego,
🔹na czym polega standard "plain language",
🔹do kogo i dlaczego warto pisać prostym językiem,
🔹na którym etapie projektu zaprosić do stołu autora tekstów,
🔹jak zmierzyć użyteczność dokumentu.

🖋Prowadząca
Anna Dominika Kwiatkowska

Projektantka treści w zespole UX w Play, współprowadzi projekt zmiany języka organizacji w komunikacji wewnętrznej i zewnętrznej. Redaktorka książek, dokumentów i instrukcji; specjalizuje się w przygotowywaniu tekstów zgodnych z zasadami prostej polszczyzny (z ang. plain language). Od 2015 roku szkoli się w Pracowni Prostej Polszczyzny przy Uniwersytecie Wrocławskim.
Pasjonatka NVC i komunikacji empatycznej. Od 2012 roku prowadzi warsztaty i szkolenia, od roku akademickiego 2017/18 wykłada "Projektowanie treści" na studiach User Experience & Product Design w Krakowie.
